title: Miranda Lambert Sassed the Crowd at a Concert and Fans Caught the Whole Thing on Video
text:
Miranda Lambert Sassed the Crowd at a Concert and Fans Caught the Whole Thing on Video

View photos Photo credit: Mark Levine - Getty Images More

From Country Living

Miranda Lambert made a statement at a recent show when she popped a beach ball on stage.

People had a lot of *opinions* after, but the Pistol Annies frontwoman likely didn't mind.

If you just bought tickets to see Miranda Lambert in concert, here’s a tip: Do not bring your beach ball.

During a recent show in Pennsylvania, the sassy country singer made it very clear that she is not amused by fans who toss around the inflatable item during her set. In fact, one concertgoer captured her reaction, and we agree with the caption that it’s “such a Miranda Lambert thing to do.”

this was such a Miranda Lambert thing to do 🤣🔪 pic.twitter.com/LEZgRYXZBQ — Kara (@karadodge) September 1, 2019

As you can see in the video, Miranda snatched up the ball, took it to the corner of the stage, and promptly popped it. “I love ya’ll, but we’re not at the d**n beach!” she called out to the crowd. “We’re singing country music tonight!”

Personally, this feels like an amazing power move. But some apparently didn’t agree with her tactics. Twitter was lighting up with responses like “you were very rude to your fans” and “she is turning people off to her music by acting so bratty.” Others said ruining the beach ball was “no fun” and “a little aggressive.”

you were very rude to your fans.!! I would never attend any of your concerts even if I got ticket's FREE!! — Leticia (@rlethi) September 2, 2019

I love Miranda like crazy but she needs not be so rude! She is turning people off to her music by acting so bratty. — robinraebyrd (@robinraebyrd2) September 4, 2019

I feel like that’s a little aggressive... it’s fun for the fans to interact w each other sometimes. Unless it was purposely hit onto the stage to disrupt her performance, then that’s not cool at all. — Renee Salazar (Cosby) (@NaeNae_25) August 31, 2019

Rich people suck....these are the fans that made you what you are..maybe we shall see if without us..what you will become — Van Ayers (@VanAyers65) September 4, 2019

So no fun — daniel freitag (@dantanna3458) September 1, 2019

But here’s the thing: Miranda has expressed in the past how much she can’t stand them at her shows. “I hate beach balls,” she reportedly said in 2009, according to The Boot. “I just feel like people are so distracted from the music when they’re trying to worry about a beach ball hitting them in the head and bouncing along like a volleyball.”

She’s even made a scene out of destroying one before, according to this video from 2016.

Finally got to see @mirandalambert destroy a beach ball in person!!! pic.twitter.com/t99DWysHTD — geananne (@Autry09) July 17, 2016

So no one can pretend they haven’t been warned. Our advice? Carry a cocktail during her concert instead.

description: She slashed a beach ball on stage and it was a THING.
